dataList.title: Humming Along
dataList.desc: Vergilius informs us of where we will be going next. While everyone seems happy and energetic, one Sinner is reacting rather strangely…

dataList.title: Inspection
dataList.desc: To everyone’s surprise, we’re told that our destination is K Corp’s Nest. The entry procedures one must go through to set foot in a Nest are supposedly quite complicated.

dataList.title: Code Purple
dataList.desc: We wait our turn to undergo the checkpoint official’s interview, with Vergilius and Ishmael instructing us on the process. Here’s hoping we’ll pass…

dataList.title: Taboo
dataList.desc: Our Dear Don Quixote’s intolerance for injustice rears its troublesome head again. Armed staff from K Corp. surround us on all sides, all the while Vergilius watches with his arms crossed, upset at our repeated failures to behave.

dataList.title: Verboten
dataList.desc: The confrontation with K Corp’s guards continues. They seem to hardly take a scratch… adding to our fatigue.

dataList.title: HP Bullets
dataList.desc: HP Bullets infused with K Corp’s Singularity render all damage we inflict on our foes useless. The Sinners are running out of patience.

dataList.title: Siegfried
dataList.desc: A man approaches from outside with tremendous speed. This exceedingly jovial and uncomfortably energetic fellow is Siegfried, who appears to have an acquaintance with Vergilius; after a friendly exchange, he rushes at our Sinners.

dataList.title: Effie—Saude, too
dataList.desc: After a chaotic encounter with Siegfried, we meet with a couple of familiar faces at the exit, greeting us with the same confidence and comportment…

dataList.title: The Deal They Struck
dataList.desc: Returning to the bus, I sense an uneasiness in the air. It looks like Vergilius isn’t going to let today’s incident go unpunished. Buena suerte, Don Quixote…!

dataList.title: Inquisitors
dataList.desc: With everything sorted out, we finally resume our journey to the town of Kalf. Before we can bask in our momentary peace, someone claiming to be an “inquisitor” leaves a hole in the back window of our bus.

dataList.title: Inquisitors 2
dataList.desc: The advance party contacted us at last. The mysterious voice coming from the transmitter was a telltale sign that something was up, throwing Sinclair into another fit of terror.

dataList.title: Inquisitors 3
dataList.desc: Groups of Inquisitors continue to assail us. Who are they, and why are they so fixated on taking my head?

dataList.title: Silent Night
dataList.desc: We’ve reached the town of Kalf. A familiar song welcomes us, followed by the morbid sight of trees festooned with horrifying things.

dataList.title: Holy Night
dataList.desc: Sinclair’s hometown of Kalf was a village of artisan prosthetists. Faust detailed the growing tendency of the public to avoid prosthesis users as the Distortion Phenomenon becomes more frequent.

dataList.title: Purification
dataList.desc: Prosthetic bodies pile up like a landfill in a corner of the town. It brings me to think about what my “true self” is.

dataList.title: Fortitude
dataList.desc: I can only feel pity for Sinclair’s struggle to repress his fear. In looking at me, he is soon reminded of an old friend.

dataList.title: Bonfire
dataList.desc: We arrived at the Sinclair family estate. Crucified prosthetic bodies await us in the courtyard. One of them is someone we can’t bear to see straight.

dataList.title: Scheiterhaufen
dataList.desc: Kromer walked inside the burning mansion. The Sinners are dismayed by Guido’s unflinching advance.

dataList.title: A Bad Dream
dataList.desc: We barely managed to defeat Guido, but Sinclair seems to be struggling to endure the immeasurable guilt weighing down on him.

dataList.title: Underpass
dataList.desc: Sinclair showed us to the basement with a suspicious passage. Faust assumes this tunnel was made by N Corp’s staff.

dataList.title: Unterführung
dataList.desc: We continue following the underground passage. The branch facility feels closer.

dataList.title: Branch K-02
dataList.desc: We’ve arrived at the branch. The room we walked into was like a torture chamber, lined with devices, contraptions, and bits of flesh.
